availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John D. "Richard" Millman (Henderson County, Kentucky, saddler; sgt 25th KY Inf & 1st lieut,17th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, saddler and soldier. Kentucky native. Saddler in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant and first sergeant from January 1, 1862, to April 13, 1862. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant and first lieutenant from September 29, 1862. Died at the Battle of Chickamauga in north Georgia on September 19, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 48.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 940.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 937.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 304, 373.
U.S. Registers of Deaths of Volunteers, 1861-1865,Kentucky, L-Z, p. 30 of 180 microfilm.
